title: Definitions
context: PART I. STATE PARKS §184-1 Definitions. As used in this part, unless otherwise indicated by the context: &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of land and natural resources. &ldquo;Land&rdquo;, without prejudice to the generality of the term, includes upland, land under water, beaches, water, and water rights. &ldquo;Park&rdquo; means an area which, by reason of location, natural features, scenic beauty or legendary, historical, or scientific interest, possesses distinctive physical, aesthetic, intellectual, creative, or social values. &ldquo;Parkway&rdquo; means an elongated park transversed by a pleasure vehicle road, but does not include the road. &ldquo;State park system&rdquo; means the parks and parkways designated by the department, control of which is acquired by the department as provided in this part. [L 1949, c 185, pt of §1; RL 1955, §19-30; am L Sp 1959 2d, c 1, §21; am L 1961, c 132, §2; HRS §184-1]
